properties.areaDesc: Callahan; Taylor; Nolan; Fisher; Haskell; Jones; Shackelford; Throckmorton
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 4 at 11:21AM CST until February 5 at 6:00PM CST by NWS San Angelo TX
properties.description:
...Heavy Snow Possible in the Big Country tonight into
Wednesday...with an area of sleet and snow possible farther south
across the Concho Valley, Heartland and Northern Edwards
Plateau...

The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a Winter
Storm Warning for heavy snow, which is in effect from 6 PM this
evening to 6 PM CST Wednesday. The Winter Storm Watch is no longer
in effect.

* WHAT...Heavy snow. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches
expected. A few localized areas may see even higher totals,
especially across the northern Big Country.

* WHERE...Haskell, Throckmorton, Fisher, Jones, Shackelford,
Nolan, Taylor, and Callahan counties.

* WHEN...From this evening through Wednesday afternoon.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Hazardous travel conditions will develop
Tuesday night and will affect the morning commute.
properties.instruction:
Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of snow. This
will make travel very hazardous or impossible.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM CST WEDNESDAY
